noun.description: A small group of words standing together as a conceptual unit, typically forming a component of a clause.

verb.description: Put into a particular form of words.
examples: it's important to phrase the question correctly

phrases: Very little (apart from a good man, a good cup of coffee, or a good piece of steak) gives me as much pleasure as a nice turn of phrase, an unexpected pun, or any other clever wordplay.
You have as much chance of hearing an unusual turn of phrase from a politician as you would from a player interview on Football Focus.
For the international market, Sagnier also brings an excellent turn of phrase in English with a sexy accent.
Merchant - his real name was Dennis Williams - who wrote the lyrics to many of Ray's compositions, had an elegant turn of phrase, a genuine concern for his fellow man, and endless energy.
origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense style or manner of expression): via late Latin from Greek phrasis, from phrazein declare, tell.
